posts.post_content:
Down to 22 total...

Cobb and Mathewson are now gone. Still have 3 Hall of Famers. Do not see how to edit the thread subject line. 

I have just acquired a collection of 1911 S74 Silks. These were all assembled by a 15 year old in 1911. He passed away in 1962, and these were sitting in his son’s home since then. It appears that he did not like the ad backs, because they have all been removed. YES, I am aware this makes them less valuable, and they are priced accordingly. Most are in pretty remarkable condition considering the age and materials. 

I have listed a bunch of them at Ebay (and ambitious prices to see if there is interest). Much rather sell them on the board, of course, so will listen to all reasonable offers. If you follow this link to [URL="https://www.ebay.com/itm/154257813343?ssPageName=STRK:MESELX:IT&_trksid=p3984.m1555.l2649"]Ty Cobb [/URL], you should be able to browse around at the scans of the ones I put up. I can provide scans of everything else. Just let me know. This is a complete list: 

s74-1 (White Backs)
Chief BenderAthleticsbrown ink          HOF
Ed KonetchyCardinalsblue ink
Roger BresnahanCardinalsbrown inkHOF
Steve EvansCardinalsbrown ink
Ed ReulbachCubs        red ink
Jimmy Sheckard  Cubs blue ink

Tom NeedhamCubsred ink
Wildfire SchulteCubsblue ink
Art DevlinGiantsred ink
Larry DoyleGiantsblue ink
Rube MarquardGiantsred inkHOF
Robert EwingPhilliesred ink
Mickey DoolanPhilliesblue ink
Art Wilson        Piratesblue ink
Howie CamnitzPiratesbrown ink
John Flynn Piratesred ink
Al Mattern        Rustlersblue ink
Ed Cy BargerSuperbasblue ink
Tony SmithSuperbasred ink
Ed Willett        Tigersblue ink


s74-2 Colored Backs (All Old Mill)
Howie CamnitzPirates (pink)

PM sent.

Mike

Sent from my SM-G950U using Tapatalk
removing them as they sell instead of putting SOLD, for easier viewing.

posts.post_title: Pm sent for Knight and Quinn
posts.post_content: I’ll take the Knight Hemphill (2) and Quinn. Pm sent...thanks and Happy holidays!
a gentle nudge back to the forefront. many sold, many still here. of the HOFers, only have sold Evers.
Just wanted to express my sincere thanks to Phil for a smooth transaction. I was really glad to be able to add these nice silks to my Yankees collection. Thanks again!
I am down to 25 of the original 79. Have not updated list in months, so this is a little bump to the front of the line. Get in touch.
